Class AdjMatGraph<T>

java.lang.Object
  AdjMatGraph<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Graph<T>, Iterable<T>
public class AdjMatGraph<T>
extends Object
implements Graph<T>, Iterable<T>

DO NOT CHANGE THIS FILE. A basic Adjacency Matrix graph implementation. Carefully consider which methods and instance variables you can use from AdjMatGraphPlus.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

AdjMatGraph

public AdjMatGraph()
Constructor. Creates an empty graph.

AdjMatGraph

public AdjMatGraph(AdjMatGraph<T> g)
Construct a copy (clone) of a given graph. The new graph will have all the same vertices and arcs as the original. A *shallow* copy is performed: the graph structure is copied, but the new graph will refer to the exact same vertex objects as the original.

Method Detail

loadTGF

public static void loadTGF(String tgf_file_name,
                           AdjMatGraph<String> g)
                    throws FileNotFoundException
Load vertices and edges from a TGF file into a given graph.

Parameters:
tgfFile - - name of the TGF file to read
g - - graph to which vertices and arcs will be added. g must be empty to start!
Throws:
FileNotFoundException

public boolean isEdge(T srcVertex,
                      T destVertex)

Specified by:
isEdge in interface Graph<T>

isUndirected

public boolean isUndirected()
Returns true IFF the graph is undirected, that is, for every pair of nodes i,j for which there is an arc, the opposite arc is also present in the graph.

Specified by:
isUndirected in interface Graph<T>

addVertex

public void addVertex(T vertex)
Adds a vertex to the graph, expanding the capacity of the graph if necessary. If the vertex already exists, it does not add it again.

Specified by:
addVertex in interface Graph<T>

removeVertex

public void removeVertex(T vertex)
Removes a single vertex with the given value from the graph. Uses equals() for testing equality.

Specified by:
removeVertex in interface Graph<T>

removeVertex

protected void removeVertex(int index)
Helper. Removes a vertex at the given index from the graph. Note that this may affect the index values of other vertices.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the index is invalid.

addEdge

public void addEdge(T vertex1,
                    T vertex2)
Inserts an edge between two vertices of the graph. If one or both vertices do not exist, ignores the addition.

Specified by:
addEdge in interface Graph<T>

                   T destVertex)
Inserts an arc from srcVertex to destVertex. If the vertices exist, else does not change the graph.
